definition: to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
(negative prefix)/not/no
bits/fragments/crumbs/filings/trifling/trivial/to condescend to
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
surname Gu
to look after/to take into consideration/to attend to

sentences.english: He shrug his low opinion of the occupant of the room.
sentences.chinese: 他聳聳肩表示對那房間的住戶不屑一顧。
他對我的提議不屑一顧。

sentences.english: Hume heaps scorn on his contractarian idea.
sentences.chinese: 休謨對他的契約論不屑一顧。

sentences.english: In Asia and America it has become fashionable to look upon these failings with disdain.
sentences.chinese: 在亞洲和美國，不屑一顧於歐洲的衰落已經蔚然成風。

sentences.english: I remember feeling disdain for this collection of ogling humanity.
sentences.chinese: 對於許多人捕風捉影的收集，我感到不屑一顧。

sentences.english: Most Ken forget the ancients poem. The disdain is missing.
sentences.chinese: 最肯忘卻古人詩，最不屑一顧是相思。

sentences.english: I only went down there to commiserate, and he was very dismissive.
sentences.chinese: 沒錯，我去是爲了表示同情，但他卻不屑一顧。

sentences.english: If they blow it, it could be their last chance.
sentences.chinese: 如果他們不屑一顧，這將是他們最後的機會。

sentences.english: Even a worldwide atlas shrugging will be interpreted several ways.
sentences.chinese: 甚至會有世界範圍內的不屑一顧。

sentences.english: He disdains corporate politics and promotes people based on merit rather than seniority.
sentences.chinese: 他對公司政治不屑一顧，超越年齡限制按才取人。

sentences.english: But everyone was scornful to it.
Her parents stood undiminished and unware of criticism.
sentences.chinese: 她父母親一如既往，對別人的批評不屑一顧。

sentences.english: Many scorn the internet as a plaything for plebs.
sentences.chinese: 良多公司對網絡不屑一顧，以爲那是一般民衆的消遣。

sentences.english: Love is when a sexy woman walks past and you don't even notice.
sentences.chinese: 愛是當性感女郎從你身邊經過時你不屑一顧。

sentences.english: He dismissed the president's claims of a bi-partisan approach.
sentences.chinese: 他對奧巴馬呼籲的兩黨合作不屑一顧。

sentences.english: He is above the insincere flattery.
sentences.chinese: 他對這種假惺惺的諂諛不屑一顧。

definition: to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
dumbstruck and unable to reply (idiom); left speechless/at a loss for words
to be obsessive/to persist obstinately
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to be cynical/to be embittered
to force someone to do something
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
to talk big/to sound off/bombastic/grandiloquent
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
specious arguments/sophistry
